pull.title: Bugfix: Only try to use git describe when .git directory exists
pull.body: Otherwise, git will happily seek to find a git directory at higher levels.

events.message: Bugfix: Only try to use git describe when .git directory exists

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/83e0a83aebee095588f2acf357e890b12380da07 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
Funny, 3 pull requests which fix the same issue open at the same time (#2804 does this also).

None of the three ever got merged, though :package: 
Shall we merge this one or close it in favor of autotools when it becomes mergeable? (as I remember autotools was about ready to merge, only needs a final squash, OKs and maybe support from pulltester)
@laanwj Do we still maintain bitcoin-qt.pro after that autotools stuff got merged? I'm a bit sceptical about it, because I never worked with it and I feel comfortable with our .pro file ^^.

Yes, we'll keep the bitcoin-qt.pro, at least as long as needed (the automake plugin for qt creator isn't up to level yet with .pro, for example it doesn't show a nice tree anymore). We'll have to maintain it ourselves, though, we cannot rely on anyone else keeping it up to date as others will build with automake.
AFAIK autotools has fixed this, so it can be closed
